tweets.content:
A quick post about #TeamWater Hack and how to avoid this kind of scam, easy to spot if you‚Äôre using @gmgn.

First, I go to the Holders and Top Traders tabs and start checking a few things:

- The AVG Mcap entry
- Total bought
- Funding & total funded amount
- Wallet Age

The goal is to identify bundles and clusters.

Now, let‚Äôs look at TeamWater in the screenshot. I‚Äôve already done the work and saved the wallets, but under normal conditions they‚Äôre mixed with many others, which makes them harder to identify.

A clear pattern emerges: all the wallets were funded via ChangeNOW and Debridge, around 64 or 75 days ago, with deposits ranging from 1.5 to 5 SOL. Each wallet entered between $300 to $950 at Mcap AVG between 31k and 90k.

Note: this applies only to this specific bundle.
The hack appears to have been executed more than one person, which means other wallets may follow different identification patterns.
Here‚Äôs another clear pattern: this cluster all share the same age, were funded by Debridge (not shown here since the wallet was last used 300d ago), and each bought similar amounts at similar Mcap.

Also, if you hover over the Hold duration section, it reveals the time of the first buy, and for these 3 wallets, the time is identical. Together, they sold over 145M tokens.

tweets.content:
Here are the elements I managed to collect:

Cupsey funds were transferred manually (2 transfers with a 21-second interval), then bridged to ETH using MAYAN FINANCE, and finally mixed through the Tornado Cash mixer.

Now, here are 4 other victims who went through EXACTLY the same procedure. Some are linked to the NOVA case but were not reimbursed, since their wallets did not interact with the main drainer‚Äôs wallets.

All incidents occurred between June 30 and September 16.

In short, here are all the common points:

All were drained manually.
All were bridged to ETH using Mayan Finance.
All were mixed through Tornado Cash.

Here are the other victims, along with the bots/apps they used and the date of the drain:

@Kgb32_ Axiom,Photon,Bullx, Nova (June 30)
@0xLiqht  Photon, Nova (July 8)
@espadAonSol Axiom,Photon, Nova  (July 15)
@prxnterr Axiom, Nova (August 22)
@Cupseyy Axiom,Photon,Nova (September 16)

They all have one app in common: Nova.

The owners clearly specified the apps they used, so this information is reliable.

This does not prove 100% that they are guilty, but everything seems to indicate that there was probably a PK leak through Nova. Moreover, they are the only ones who did not use Turnkey.

A total of $700k was drained with these 5 wallets.

In January, when Trump launched his memecoin, I was preparing for a job after being laid off for 7 months. I saw a tweet: ‚ÄúHow did someone turn $100 into $100k in $TRUMP?‚Äù

I had around $450 in my bank account and only one month of rent left. So, I thought, ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs take a risk with $250 and turn it into $250k.‚Äù

At first, I didn‚Äôt know about BullX, Photon, or Axiom. I started trading using DexScreener üò≠üòÇ. After some research‚Ä¶ I LOST IT ALL.

A month passed. I didn‚Äôt get a job, my rent money was gone, and I had to return home even though I didn‚Äôt want to.

I noticed people with followers on X were earning more. So in February, I started my own X account for crypto.

First I came with X of @Euris_x. I didn‚Äôt even know about @orangie and @Cupseyy at that time.I did not know what is wallet tracking, what the fhak is KOL.

I thought, ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs give it a try. This time I‚Äôll make it.‚Äù
I took a $1000 loan, bought 3 SOL, and subscribed to 1 month of X Premium. LOST 90% of it all.

Then, I came to know about Alpha Groups. My first Alpha Group was @Shocked, which I won in a giveaway from @kbz012 (the best trader and a great human, he has done more for me than anyone else on this planet. I‚Äôll write more about him later in the thread).

tweets.content:
The Cognitive Blueprint for Trading Memecoins üßµ

There are two types of traders: those who make money, and those who don‚Äôt. That‚Äôs it. No middle ground.
If you‚Äôre breaking even, you‚Äôre still paying, with your time. Whether that time turns into a real investment depends entirely on your ability to learn and adapt.
This isn‚Äôt your typical thread.

I‚Äôm fascinated by psychology, and I want to give you a perspective on this game that might shift how you think.
tweets.author: SoloJayQ

tweets.content:
Ok. Since it looks like EVERYONE is getting drained by this guy, let me break down exactly how he‚Äôs doing it:

Step 1 ‚Äì The bait:
He reaches out asking for ‚Äúhelp learning to trade,‚Äù offering 20‚Äì50 SOL as payment.

Step 2 ‚Äì The flex:
On a Discord call, he shows off a ‚Äúbig wallet,‚Äù huge PnL screenshots, and gambling site balances to make himself look legit.

Step 3 ‚Äì The setup:
He asks you to create a new Axiom account. While doing this, he insists you use your mouse to copy/paste everything ‚Äúso you don‚Äôt lose the password.‚Äù

Step 4 ‚Äì The trap:
What he doesn‚Äôt tell you is that when you copy/paste with your mouse, your screen flashes the last thing you copied. He‚Äôs recording your screen the whole time. That‚Äôs how he gets your login info.

Step 5 ‚Äì The theft:
He then has you send SOL to your trading wallet (sometimes even sending some himself to make it seem safe). Once you‚Äôre in, he uses the captured info to log into your account and drain it. If you reused the same password elsewhere, he takes those too.

These guys aren‚Äôt ‚Äúhacker wizards.‚Äù 

They‚Äôre just exploiting simple human error.

Not blaming victims here at all. It‚Äôs a dirty trick and easy to fall for specially when this russian MF does not stop spamming questions non stop.

Stay sharp, don‚Äôt screen-share sensitive actions, and always protect your info. <3

The drains quietly started in early July, without much noise. But on the 15th, more and more people began getting hit, that‚Äôs when I started investigating.

That‚Äôs why Nova quickly became the prime suspect.

tweets.content:
To clarify: 

The data seems to only account for tokens from before the migration, so traders who entered after bond (Raydium or Pumpswap) don‚Äôt appear to be included. Only the sells from wallets that entered before the migration are reflected. 

So in this context, "Pump.fun top traders" represents the traders who entered before the migration. 

But the realized profits reflect the total PnL of the wallet, whatever the tokens were sold before or after the migration. 

Example: Cupsey didn‚Äôt make $24M PnL just by trading exclusively on Pump.fun non-migrate token, the total includes all realized profits.
